benchmark_details.name: CHIRP: A Fine-Grained Benchmark for Open-Ended Response Evaluation in Vision-Language Models
benchmark_details.overview: CHIRP is a hybrid evaluation benchmark developed for assessing Vision-Language Models (VLMs), featuring 104 open-ended questions that require complex and creative responses. It combines human evaluations and automated metrics for more robust assessments.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation framework that captures nuanced differences in model performance by focusing on open-ended responses.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark is limited to 104 questions, which may restrict comprehensive evaluations across a wider model variety.

data.source: Generated dataset using GPT-4 for question formulation and DALL-E 3 for image generation.
data.annotation: Manual refinement of questions and image descriptions combined with AI-generated content.

methodology.calculation: Elo scores based on pairwise comparisons of model responses.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Elo scores indicate better perceived performance based on evaluators' judgments.
methodology.baseline_results: Evaluation against existing benchmarks like VQA, GQA, TextVQA.
methodology.validation: Human evaluations across various criteria were utilized to validate model rankings.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Evaluation data includes diverse participant demographics.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential for evaluative bias based on user preferences.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Evaluatorsâ€™ privacy ensured through anonymous participation.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent obtained from all human evaluators before participation.
